title: Drawing, "Chama Below the Summit", 1892
medium: Brush and gray wash, watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper
markings: Recto: Stamped in black ink, lower left: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457c]
signed: Signed with initials and dated in graphite, top center: Chamma [sic.] below Summit TM 1892.
inscribed: Recto: Inscribed in graphite, upper center: Chamma (sic) below Summit TM 1892 Verso: Inscribed in ink, upper left corner:  No. 306.
description: Landscape with railroad track in lower right foreground; view across ravine, with evergreen tree thicket, to Rocky Mountain range. Glimpse of train with smoke-belching engine, right of center, traversing mountain ridge.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Chama Below the Summit", 1892.
1892. Brush and gray wash, watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-50.
